data.question: What is the role of the 30 valence electron rule in triple-decker complexes?
data.answer: The 30 valence electron rule plays the same role for triple-decker complexes as the 18-electron rule for mononuclear organometallic complexes.

data.question: Why have no anionic 30e triple-decker complexes been reported before?
data.answer: No anionic 30e triple-decker complexes have been reported because no reactions were known that would allow introduction of 12e fragments into a sandwich complex.

data.question: What reacts with the 12e building block Cr(CO)3?
data.answer: (Borole)metal sandwich anions react with the 12e building block Cr(CO)3.

data.question: Is the complex 2 stable in aqueous solution?

Are the ring ligands in the anion 2 planar?
What is the deviation of the ring ligands from being planar in the anion 2?
Do the Cr-CO distances in anion 2 significantly differ from those in [NMe3][CpCr(CO)3]?
What type of structure does the anion 2 have?
What other 18e anions with borole ligands react with [Cr(CO)3(NH3)3]?
Is the structure of Cd(SPh)2 three-dimensionally non-molecular?
What is the melting point of Bis(benzenethiolato)cadmium(II)?
Does the structure of Cd(SPh)2 include linked adamantanoid cages?
What is the proposed structure formed upon dissolution of 1 in DMF?
data.answer: Cd10(SPh)20 2, with the tetra-adamantanoid cage structure

data.question: Are the adamantanoid cages in the structure of 1 linked in a helical sequence?
What is the coordination of Cd2+ in 1?
data.answer: Cd2+ in 1 is coordinated only by PhS-.

data.question: Is the structure of 1 unprecedented for complexes with organic substituents?
What causes the three-dimensional non-molecularity in the structure of 1?
data.answer: The helical connections and the interweaving of the chains parallel to a and b are the source of the three-dimensional non-molecularity.

data.question: What is the chemical shift of the principal species generated when 1 dissolves in DMF?
data.answer: The chemical shift is very close to that of the adamantanoid cage [Cd4(SPh)10]2-.

data.question: Does the structure of Cd(SPh)2 derive from the conception of the Cd4S10 adamantanoid cage as a large tetrahedron?
